intro: Didelta cernua, commonly known as the drooping heartleaf, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It features heart-shaped leaves that are often drooping or curling at the edges, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters, typically blooming in the spring. Its foliage is often covered in fine, soft hairs, which contribute to its distinctive appearance. Didelta cernua thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
